text: Aretha Franklin performs during the ` ` Clive Davis : The Soundtrack of Our Lives'' premiere concert on April 19, 2017, in New York City. ( Photo : Theo Wargo / Getty Images ) The Queen of Soul Aretha Franklin died on Thursday from advanced pancreatic cancer at the age of 76. Pancreatic cancer is one of the most difficult types of cancer to detect, and people usually don't show symptoms until it has already spread to other organs, according to the American Cancer Society. The pancreas is deeply seated in the body, making it difficult for doctors to see or feel tumors during routine check - ups. Many celebrities died from pancreatic cancer Franklin's death sent shock waves through the world, and incited heartfelt reactions and condolences from many famous people
